message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) because it deals with named entity recognition and text mining, which are both sub-fields of natural language processing. It could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) because the method proposed in the paper can be used to improve information retrieval systems by identifying and clustering named entities. Additionally, the use of word embeddings models suggests that the paper could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves clustering, which is a common technique in unsupervised learning, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on a specific topic and the use of semantic similarity scores suggest that it could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
